sen.j: 草壁皇子（くさかべのみこ（おうじ）、天智天皇元年（662年） - 持統天皇3年4月13日 (旧暦)（689年5月7日）は、天武天皇と皇后鸕野讃良皇女（持統天皇）の皇子。
sen.e: Prince Kusakabe (662-May 10, 689) was a son of Emperor Temmu and Princess Uno no Sarara (Empress Jito).
Prince Kusakabe (662-May 10, 689) was a son of Emperor Temmu and Princess Uno no Sarara (Empress Jito).
Prince Kusakabe (662-May 10, 689) was a son of Emperor Temmu and Princess Uno no Sarara (Empress Jito).

sen.j: 妃は天智天皇の皇女で持統天皇の異母妹である阿陪（あへ）皇女（後の元明天皇）。
sen.e: His wife was Princess Ahe (later the Empress Genmei), who was a daughter of Emperor Tenchi and a half-sister of Empress Jito.
His wife was Princess Ahe (later the Empress Genmei), who was a daughter of Emperor Tenchi and a half-sister of Empress Jito.
His wife was Princess Ahe (later the Empress Genmei), who was a daughter of Emperor Tenchi and a half-sister of Empress Jito.

sen.j: 元正天皇・吉備内親王（後の長屋王妃）・文武天皇の父。
sen.e: Prince Kusakabe was a father of Empress Gensho, Imperial Princess Kibi (later the wife of Prince Nagaya), and Emperor Mommu.
Prince Kusakabe was a father of Empress Gensho, Imperial Princess Kibi (later the wife of Prince Nagaya), and Emperor Mommu.
Prince Kusakabe was a father of Empress Gensho, Imperial Princess Kibi (later the wife of Prince Nagaya), and Emperor Mommu.

sen.j: 諡号は岡宮御宇天皇（おかのみやにあめのしたしろしめししすめらみこと、または、おかのみやぎょうてんのう）。
sen.e: His shigo (a posthumous name) was Okanomiyani amenoshita shiroshimeshishi Sumeramikoto or Okanomiya gyo tenno.
His shigo (a posthumous name) was Okanomiyani amenoshita shiroshimeshishi Sumeramikoto or Okanomiya gyo tenno.
His shigo (a posthumous name) was Okanomiyani amenoshita shiroshimeshishi Sumeramikoto or Okanomiya gyo tenno.

sen.j: 岡宮天皇あるいは長岡天皇とも称される。
sen.e: He was also called Emperor Okamiya or Emperor Nagaoka.
He was also called Emperor Okamiya or Emperor Nagaoka.
He was also called Emperor Okamiya or Emperor Nagaoka.

sen.j: 天智天皇元年（662年）に誕生。
sen.e: Prince Kusakabe was born in 662.
Prince Kusakabe was born in 662.
Prince Kusakabe was born in 662.

sen.j: 天武天皇元年（672年）、壬申の乱が勃発すると、大津皇子ら、他の兄弟達と共に両親に同伴する。
sen.e: In 672, at the outbreak of Jinshin War, he accompanied his parents with other brothers including Prince Otsu.
In 672, at the outbreak of Jinshin War, he accompanied his parents with other brothers including Prince Otsu.
In 672, at the outbreak of Jinshin War, he accompanied his parents with other brothers including Prince Otsu.

sen.j: 天武天皇2年（673年）、2月27日に飛鳥浄御原宮で天武天皇が即位。
sen.e: On March 23, 673, Emperor Temmu ascended the throne at Asuka Kiyohara no miya Imperial residence.
On March 23, 673, Emperor Temmu ascended the throne at Asuka Kiyohara no miya Imperial residence.
On March 23, 673, Emperor Temmu ascended the throne at Asuka Kiyohara no miya Imperial residence.

sen.j: 天武天皇8年（679年）には吉野の盟約で事実上の後継者となり、天武天皇10年（681年）、2月に皇太子。
sen.e: Prince Kusakabe became the facto successor at Yoshino Pact in 679, and became the crown prince in February, 681.
Prince Kusakabe became the de facto successor at Yoshino Pact in 679, and became the crown prince in February, 681.
sen.cmt: facto の前にde を追加
sen.e: Prince Kusakabe became the de facto successor at Yoshino Pact in 679, and became the crown prince in February, 681.

sen.j: おそらく、母の鵜野讃良皇后の身分の高さと、既に彼女の姉の大田皇女が死去している事から、大津皇子を押さえ、皇太子になったものと思われる。
sen.e: Since his mother, Empress Uno no Sarara, was a person of position and her older sister had already died, it is considered that he became the crown prince before Prince Otsu.
Since his mother, Empress Uno no Sarara, was a person of position and her older sister had already died, it is considered that he became the crown prince before Prince Otsu.
Since his mother, Empress Uno no Sarara, was a person of position and her older sister had already died, it is considered that he became the crown prince before Prince Otsu.

sen.j: 朱鳥元年（686年）7月には重態に陥った天武天皇から母と共に大権を委任され、9月には天武天皇が崩御する。
sen.e: In August, 686, he and his mother were entrusted with the sovereign right from Emperor Temmu who were seriously ill, after that Emperor Temmu demised in September.
In August, 686, he and his mother were entrusted with the sovereign right from Emperor Temmu who were seriously ill, after that Emperor Temmu demised in September.
In August, 686, he and his mother were entrusted with the sovereign right from Emperor Temmu who were seriously ill, after that Emperor Temmu demised in September.

sen.j: 翌月には謀反の罪で大津皇子が処刑される。
sen.e: Next month, Prince Otsu was executed on charge of rebellion.
Next month, Prince Otsu was executed on charge of rebellion.
Next month, Prince Otsu was executed on charge of rebellion.

sen.j: だが、鵜野讃良皇后は皇子を直ちに即位させる事はしなかった。
sen.e: However, Empress Uno no Sarara, didn't let Prince Kusakabe ascend the throne immediately after the execution of Prince Otsu.
However, Empress Uno no Sarara, did not let Prince Kusakabe ascend the throne immediately after the execution of Prince Otsu.
However, Empress Uno no Sarara, did not let Prince Kusakabe ascend the throne immediately after the execution of Prince Otsu.

sen.j: 皇子の若さと大津皇子処刑に対する宮廷内の反感が皇子の即位の障害となったものと思われる。
sen.e: It seems that his youth and antipathy toward Prince Otsu's execution at Imperial Court prevented his enthronement.
It seems that his youth and antipathy toward Prince Otsu's execution at Imperial Court prevented his enthronement.
It seems that his youth and antipathy toward Prince Otsu's execution at Imperial Court prevented his enthronement.

sen.j: 持統天皇3年（689年）4月13日に皇位に就くことなく薨去。
sen.e: On May 10, 689, he died without ascending the throne.
On May 10, 689, he died without ascending the throne.
On May 10, 689, he died without ascending the throne.

sen.j: 淳仁天皇即位後の天平宝字2年（758年）に「岡宮御宇天皇」の称号が贈られた。
sen.e: In 758, after the enthronement of Emperor Junnin, Prince Kusakabe was conferred the title "Okanomiyani amenoshita shiroshimeshishi Sumeramikoto or Okanomiya gyo tenno."
In 758, after the enthronement of Emperor Junnin, Prince Kusakabe was conferred the title "Okanomiyani amenoshita shiroshimeshishi Sumeramikoto or Okanomiya gyo tenno."
In 758, after the enthronement of Emperor Junnin, Prince Kusakabe was conferred the title "Okanomiyani amenoshita shiroshimeshishi Sumeramikoto or Okanomiya gyo tenno."

sen.j: 万葉集に、石川内命婦に贈った歌が一首残されている。
sen.e: The poem which he sent to ISHIKAWA no Uchimyobu is found in "Manyoshu (Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves)."
The poem which he sent to ISHIKAWA no Uchimyobu is found in "Manyoshu (Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves)."
The poem which he sent to ISHIKAWA no Uchimyobu is found in "Manyoshu (Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves)."

sen.j: 陵は、奈良県高市郡高取町の眞弓丘陵である。
sen.e: His tomb is the Mayumi no oka Mausoleum, that is located in Takatori-cho, Takaichi-gun, Nara Prefecture.
His tomb is the Mayumi no oka Mausoleum, that is located in Takatori-cho, Takaichi-gun, Nara Prefecture.
His tomb is the Mayumi no oka Mausoleum, that is located in Takatori-cho, Takaichi-gun, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 早世した草壁皇子だが、両親・妻・息子・娘と近親者（さらに次女・吉備内親王の夫、長屋王も実際は特例として親王待遇を受け、皇位継承権があったとの説が指摘されている）の殆どが皇位につき、彼の子孫達は天武系の嫡流として奈良時代における文化・政治の担い手となった。
sen.e: Prince Kusakabe died at an early age, however, most of his families including his parents, wife, sons, daughters and close relatives took throne (moreover the theory that Prince Nagaya, who was the husband of his second daughter Imperial Princess Kibi was also treated as Imperial Prince as a special case and had the right of succession to the Imperial Throne has been pointed out), while his descendants became bearers of culture and politics as main branch of the Imperial line from the Emperor Tenmu in Nara Period.

Prince Kusakabe died at an early age, however, most of his families including his parents, wife, sons, daughters and close relatives took throne (moreover the theory that Prince Nagaya, who was the husband of his second daughter Imperial Princess Kibi was also treated as Imperial Prince as a special case and had the right of succession to the Imperial Throne has been pointed out), while his descendants became bearers of culture and politics as main branch of the Imperial line from the Emperor Tenmu in Nara Period.

Prince Kusakabe died at an early age, however, most of his families including his parents, wife, sons, daughters and close relatives took throne (moreover the theory that Prince Nagaya, who was the husband of his second daughter Imperial Princess Kibi was also treated as Imperial Prince as a special case and had the right of succession to the Imperial Throne has been pointed out), while his descendants became bearers of culture and politics as main branch of the Imperial line from the Emperor Tenmu in Nara Period.

sen.j: しかし、男系は744年（天平16年）の曾孫・安積親王の早世（藤原仲麻呂による暗殺説あり）で途絶えてしまった。
sen.e: However, its male line came to an end in 744, when his great grandchild, Prince Asaka, died at an early age. (There is the theory that he was assassinated by FUJIWARA no Nakamaro.)
However, its male line came to an end in 744, when his great grandchild, Prince Asaka, died at an early age. (There is a theory that he was assassinated by FUJIWARA no Nakamaro.)
sen.cmt: theoryの冠詞を theから aに変更
sen.e: However, its male line came to an end in 744, when his great grandchild, Prince Asaka, died at an early age. (There is a theory that he was assassinated by FUJIWARA no Nakamaro.)

sen.j: 女系については、曾孫の不破内親王と塩焼王（草壁皇子の甥）との間に生まれた氷上川継(草壁皇子の玄孫)も、天智系の桓武天皇が即位した直後に謀反の疑いを受け、弟の氷上志計志麻呂とともの流刑となった（氷上川継の乱）。
sen.e: When it comes to the maternal side of a family, HIKAMI Kawatsugu (the great-great-grandson of Prince Kusakabe), the son of his great grandchild Imperial Princess Fuwa and Prince Shioyaki (a nephew of Prince Kusakabe) was also banished on a charge of rebellion with his younger brother, HIKAMI no Shikeshimaro (HIKAMI no Kawatsugu's War).

When it comes to the maternal side of a family, HIKAMI Kawatsugu (the great-great-grandson of Prince Kusakabe), the son of his great grandchild Imperial Princess Fuwa and Prince Shioyaki (a nephew of Prince Kusakabe) was also banished on a charge of rebellion with his younger brother, HIKAMI no Shikeshimaro (HIKAMI no Kawatsugu's War).

When it comes to the maternal side of a family, HIKAMI Kawatsugu (the great-great-grandson of Prince Kusakabe), the son of his great grandchild Imperial Princess Fuwa and Prince Shioyaki (a nephew of Prince Kusakabe) was also banished on a charge of rebellion with his younger brother, HIKAMI no Shikeshimaro (HIKAMI no Kawatsugu's War).

sen.j: その後、桓武天皇崩御後に許され帰京した。
sen.e: Then, after the demise of Emperor Kammu, they were forgiven and returned to Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Then, after the demise of Emperor Kammu, they were forgiven and returned to Kyoto.
Then, after the demise of Emperor Kammu, they were forgiven and returned to Kyoto.

sen.j: しかし、伊豆守に任じられた812年（弘仁3年）を最後に消息が途絶える事となる。
sen.e: However, after he was appointed Izu no kami (Governor of Izu Province) in 812, he was never heard of again.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, after he was appointed Izu no kami (Governor of Izu Province) in 812, he was never heard of again.
However, after he was appointed Izu no kami (Governor of Izu Province) in 812, he was never heard of again.

sen.j: 不破内親王の姉の井上内親王（聖武天皇の娘）と白壁王（後の光仁天皇）との間の子である他戸親王(草壁皇子の玄孫)が、伯母の孝謙天皇称徳天皇が崩御に伴い、父王が即位した時に天智・天武皇統融合の象徴として立太子された。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Osabe (the great-great-grandson of Prince Kusakabe), who was the son of Imperial Princess Inoe (a daughter of Emperor Temmu), a older sister of Imperial Princess Fuwa, and Shirakabe no okimi (Prince Shirakabe, later Emperor Konin) was formally installed as Crown Prince as the symbol of merger of Tenchi and Temmu Imperial Line at the time of enthronement of his father, with demise of his aunt, Empress Koken Empress Shotoku.

Imperial Prince Osabe (the great-great-grandson of Prince Kusakabe), who was the son of Imperial Princess Inoe (a daughter of Emperor Temmu), a older sister of Imperial Princess Fuwa, and Shirakabe no okimi (Prince Shirakabe, later Emperor Konin), was formally installed as Crown Prince as the symbol of merger of Tenchi and Temmu Imperial Line at the time of enthronement of his father, with demise of his aunt, Empress Koken Empress Shotoku.
sen.cmt: was formally installedの前にカンマを挿入
sen.e: Imperial Prince Osabe (the great-great-grandson of Prince Kusakabe), who was the son of Imperial Princess Inoe (a daughter of Emperor Temmu), a older sister of Imperial Princess Fuwa, and Shirakabe no okimi (Prince Shirakabe, later Emperor Konin), was formally installed as Crown Prince as the symbol of merger of Tenchi and Temmu Imperial Line at the time of enthronement of his father, with demise of his aunt, Empress Koken Empress Shotoku.

sen.j: しかしながら、他戸親王の立太子に反対していた藤原式家の藤原良継・藤原百川兄弟の陰謀に遭い、光仁天皇を呪ったとして庶人に落とされ、母共々変死した。
sen.e: However, Imperial Prince Osabe was entrapped by a scheme of FUJIWARA no Yoshitsugu and a FUJIWARA no Momokawa (brothers) from the Ceremonial House of the Fujiwara clan who opposed his investiture of the Crown Prince, and after he was demoted to common people for putting a curse on Emperor Konin, he and his mother died an unnatural death.

However, Imperial Prince Osabe was entrapped by a scheme of FUJIWARA no Yoshitsugu and a FUJIWARA no Momokawa (brothers) from the Ceremonial House of the Fujiwara clan who opposed his investiture of the Crown Prince; and eventually he was demoted to common people for allegedly having put a curse on Emperor Konin, thereafter he and his mother died an unnatural death.
sen.cmt: 後半部分の表現の見直し
sen.e: However, Imperial Prince Osabe was entrapped by a scheme of FUJIWARA no Yoshitsugu and a FUJIWARA no Momokawa (brothers) from the Ceremonial House of the Fujiwara clan who opposed his investiture of the Crown Prince; and eventually he was demoted to common people for allegedly having put a curse on Emperor Konin, thereafter he and his mother died an unnatural death.

sen.j: 他戸親王の姉の酒人内親王は桓武天皇の妃となり、朝原内親王(平城天皇の妃)を儲けたが、彼女は子を成さなかったのでここで断絶した。
sen.e: Imperial Princess Sakahito, who is a older sister of Imperial Prince Osabe, became a wife of the Emperor Kammu and gave birth to Princess Asahara, Emperor Heizei's wife, however, Princess Asahara were not able to have a children and the maternal side of a family came to an end.

Imperial Princess Sakahito, who was an older sister of Imperial Prince Osabe, became a wife of the Emperor Kammu and gave birth to Princess Asahara (Emperor Heizei's wife), however, Princess Asahara was not able to have a child and the maternal side of a family came to an end.
sen.cmt: is a older sister を was an older sister に変更、were not able to をwas not able toに変更。children をchildに変更。
sen.e: Imperial Princess Sakahito, who was an older sister of Imperial Prince Osabe, became a wife of the Emperor Kammu and gave birth to Princess Asahara (Emperor Heizei's wife), however, Princess Asahara was not able to have a child and the maternal side of a family came to an end.

sen.j: 臣籍降下した中では承和 (日本)11年（844年）に玄孫の峯緒王(吉備内親王の曾孫)が高階真人姓を賜り高階氏の祖となった。
sen.e: In 844, among the Imperial Families those descended to subject status, Prince Mineo (a great-grandchild of Imperial Princess Kibi) was given the surname of "TAKASHINA no Mahito", and became the ancestor of the Takashina clan.

In 844, among the Imperial Families that had undergone demotion from nobility to subject, Prince Mineo (a great-grandchild of Imperial Princess Kibi) was given the surname of "TAKASHINA no Mahito", and became the ancestor of the Takashina clan.
sen.cmt: 「臣籍降下」をdemotion from nobility to subject と訳出
sen.e: In 844, among the Imperial Families that had undergone demotion from nobility to subject, Prince Mineo (a great-grandchild of Imperial Princess Kibi) was given the surname of "TAKASHINA no Mahito", and became the ancestor of the Takashina clan.

sen.j: しかし彼の孫の高階師尚で養子に変わっているため、その系統は断絶した。
sen.e: However, since Mineo's grandson TAKASHINA no Moronao was an adopted child, his family line came to an end.
However, since Mineo's grandson TAKASHINA no Moronao was an adopted child, his family line came to an end.
However, since Mineo's grandson TAKASHINA no Moronao was an adopted child, his family line came to an end.
